action.action-desc: Mr. Coburn (for himself and Mr. Udall of Colorado) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prohibit the use of public funds for political party conventions.

section.header: Prohibiting use of presidential election campaign funds for party conventions

subsection.text: Chapter 95 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking section 9008.
The table of sections of chapter 95 of such Code is amended by striking the item relating to section 9008.
The third sentence of section 9006(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking , section 9008(b)(3),.
Section 9009(a) of such Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by adding and at the end of paragraph (2);
by striking the semicolon at the end of paragraph (3) and inserting a period; and

subsection.text: Section 9012 of such Code is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(1), by striking the second sentence; and
in subsection (c), by striking paragraph (2) and redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (2).

subsection.header: Availability of payments from presidential primary matching payment account
subsection.text: The second sentence of section 9037(a) of such Code is amended by striking and for payments under section 9008(b)(3).

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to elections occurring after December 31, 2012.
